A security engineer is setting up a new AWS account. The engineer has been asked to continuously monitor the company's AWS account using automated compliance checks based on AWS best practices and Center for Internet Security (CIS) AWS Foundations Benchmarks.
How can the security engineer accomplish this using AWS services?

discussion.content:
A.
Enable Config - you cant enable Inspector, you run assessment.
Enable Security Hub - gives you auto checks on best practice & CIS

comments.content: In addition, the Security Hub conducts continuous checks against the CIS security standards.

discussion.content: Its A: https://docs.aws.amazon.com/securityhub/latest/userguide/securityhub-standards-cis-config-resources.html

Selected Answer: A
A. Enable AWS Config and set it to record all resources in all Regions and global resources. Then enable AWS Security Hub and confirm that the CIS AWS Foundations compliance standard is enabled.

Explanation:

 AWS Config: It allows you to assess, audit, and evaluate the configurations of your AWS resources. By enabling AWS Config, you can continuously monitor resource configurations based on AWS best practices.

 AWS Security Hub: It provides a comprehensive view of your high-priority security alerts and compliance status. Enabling AWS Security Hub allows you to get automated compliance checks based on industry standards, such as the CIS AWS Foundations Benchmarks.

This combination of AWS Config and AWS Security Hub covers continuous monitoring based on AWS best practices and CIS AWS Foundations Benchmarks. It offers automated compliance checks and security insights into your AWS account.

A is the correct answer here. First we must enable AWS Config in all regions to enable governance over global resources. Then configure AWS Security Hub and confirm that the CIS AWS Foundations compliance standard are enabled. A
